pr_title: Increase default maximumPoolSize property in jdbc-site.xml

timeline.message:
Increase default maximumPoolSize property in jdbc-site.xml

The default value for jdbc.pool.property.maximumPoolSize is causing
problems in multiple users. The out-of-the-box experience for PXF with
JDBC is not great because an error is encountered during writes for
example when we have a large amount of data. The same is true for reads
that transfer large amounts of data.

This error is encountered on segment hosts that have more than 5
segments per host. A typical use case for PXF is residing on a host with
8 segments per hosts. This issue will surface right away on those
segment hosts. In some cases users have 12 segments per host. Increasing
the maximumPoolSize to 15 seems like a new sensible default that will
allow the out-of-the-box experience be smoother for PXF.

timeline.bodyText: this will not take effect on pre-existing RPM installations after upgrade. we should release doc this, @lisakowen fyi
timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: yes, anyone that has already configured the JDBC connector using the jdbc-site.xml will either manually have to modify their jdbc.pool.property.maximumPoolSize value to 15 in case they want to have the defaults that PXF provides
replies.author: frankgh

replies.bodyText:
thanks for calling this out.  i was going to ask about upgrade implication for all of the *-xite.xml changes in 5.16:  the commenting out of pxf.service.user.name in pxf-site.xml, the new pxf.fs.basepath property in pxf-site.xml, and this.
yes, we will release note each of these changes.  and upgrade should probably identify each and provide info to the user as to if/when they might want to change their current server definitions.
replies.author: lisakowen

replies.bodyText: this will NOT impact not only anyone that has already configured the JDBC connector, but everyone who already had a previous version installed (already ran pxf init, as we copy the templates to PXF_CONF/templates).
replies.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: Actually, we overwrite templates during init inside $PXF_CONF/templates, and you are required to re-init anyway. So this will not affect people that already had their templates inside PXF_CONF/templates because we have to overwrite them anyway.
replies.author: frankgh
